ygData.subject: Another New Paper:  Multiagent HyperNEAT

David D'Ambrosio and I discuss the potential for HyperNEAT 
controlling mul=
tiple heterogeneous agents in this new 
paper, "Generative Encoding for Mul=
tiagent Learning," to appear at 
GECCO 2008:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index=
.php?
option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28#dambrosio.gecco0=
8

Direct Link:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/dambrosio_gecco08.pdf

We a=
lso have a nice sample of videos that depict various evolved 
teams in acti=
on:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/multiagenthyperneat

The interesting idea in t=
his paper is that just as a single 
connective CPPN can encode how a single=
 network varies over space, 
it can also encode how a *set* of networks (ea=
ch representing the 
policy of one agent on the team) varies over space.  I=
n this way, 
HyperNEAT can learn an expression that encodes how policies va=
ry 
over the team geometry.  For example, in a soccer team agents vary 
fro=
m defensive to offensive as you move away from the goal.  Part of 
the powe=
r of this approach is that it means basic skills can be 
learned and shared=
 among the whole team, since the CPPN encodes how 
those skills vary across=
 the field.

ken
